plugins.name: Custom Frame Presets
plugins.description:
Create your own sets of reusable frame presets with custom dimensions & other settings. üòç You no longer need to stick to the default limted set of frame sizes which are predefined in Figma.

How to add custom frame presets in Figma?
Create a new collection of presets by clicking the plus (+) icon at the top (leave key field empty). Then click the pencil (edit) icon on the group to add your own presets or edit the names. When done editing the collection, click the checkmark icon near the group name.

Simply click the desired preset to apply it to all selected frames. If no frames are selected, a new frame will be created.

The plugin doesn‚Äôt only save dimensions, but also other frames properties like color, effects, grids and export settings. You also can share your templates with teammates or, if you fancy it, Figma community. Import a shared template by entering the key and pressing plus icon, try it with key ‚Äúbootstrap‚Äù (without quotes).

Resizing the plugin window:
You can resize the window of the plugin by pressing Cmd/Ctrl + Arrow keys when the plugin window is in focus (click anywhere in the window if resize is not working) ‚Äî similar to how you can resize objects in Figma.

Known issues:
‚Ä¢¬†All templates are currently saved locally to your Figma app or browser. If you clear the browser cache, reinstall the app or log out of Figma, your templates may be lost.
‚Ä¢¬†You cannot reoder groups or templates yet. I may add this functionality in the future if there are enough requests.

plugins.name: Make Hover State
plugins.description:
Take any component or variant set and quickly scaffold hover states for them with interactive components.


By the mad scientists at Shift Lab. Want to work with us? We're hiring!


Get Started

  1. Select one or more components and/or variant sets
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Style your new hover state variants!


This will generate a clone of the existing component (or each variant in a component set), create a variant property group called Hovered with True and False values, and connect the new variant up to the original with a hover interaction trigger.


Limitations

There is currently a limitation with variant sets, where the plugin doesn't work if there is already a property group with the word "hover" in it. This is built in so that in future the plugin can support intelligently completing half-built variant sets, but it seems like it would be very prone to edge cases so I'm not sure if I'll ever support it. For now, use the plugin on either sole components or variant sets without hover states defined.

accepted.name: Frank Johnson
accepted.description: Product Manager / UX Designer at Shift. Lover of DIY culture, CMS design, and the open web.

plugins.name: Textsmith
plugins.description:
Textsmith is the ultimate text reshaping tool that lets you easily manipulate, transform, distort, and warp text for creative and professional designs. With its redesigned drag-and-drop interface, new advanced tools, and built-in shortcut key support, it‚Äôs perfect for typography design, logos, posters, and more.


üöÄ What it does:

Textsmith simplifies text manipulation by allowing users to reshape text directly. Whether you need to bend, morph, or customize fonts, this tool makes it effortless. With access to a huge library of Google Fonts, customizable fill colors, and stroke colors, you can create unique typography distortion effects in seconds. Advanced features like zooming, panning, background grids, snap-to-grid, undo/redo, and shortcut key support give you precise control over your designs.


Once your design is ready, it is automatically exported as an SVG path, where you can take advantage of Figma‚Äôs built-in SVG path editing capabilities for additional fine-tuning.


‚öôÔ∏è Key Features:

  1. Reshape text with drag-and-drop control points.
  2. Access a vast library of Google Fonts for endless design options.
  3. Apply text warping and bending for creative typography.
  4. Use control mirroring to mirror control point positions horizontally or vertically.
  5. Customize fill colors and stroke colors to enhance your designs.
  6. Seamlessly integrate with Figma for advanced path editing.
  7. NEW: Enable or disable background grids for precise alignment.
  8. NEW: Snap to the grid for perfect positioning or turn it off for freeform creativity.
  9. NEW: Undo and redo functionality for quick corrections.
  10. NEW: Zoom and pan controls for better navigation and close-up editing.
  11. NEW: Shortcut key support for all new features, making your workflow faster and more efficient.


üìù Instructions: Using Textsmith is quick and easy:

  1. Input the text you want to reshape.
  2. Select a font from our extensive library of Google Fonts.
  3. Drag control points to distort, transform, or warp the text as needed.
  4. [Optional] Use control mirroring to achieve symmetrical designs by mirroring control points horizontally or vertically.
  5. [Optional] Pick a fill color and a stroke color to further customize your text.
  6. Use zoom and pan controls to focus on specific areas of your design.
  7. Use undo and redo to make quick corrections.
  8. Once you‚Äôre done, your reshaped text is automatically added to Figma as an SVG path, ready for fine-tuning using Figma‚Äôs path editing tools.


Textsmith is the ultimate typography tool for designers looking to reshape, warp, or transform text into creative and professional designs. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or a seasoned designer, Textsmith makes it easy to create stunning text distortion effects for any project.


Start reshaping text today with Textsmith ‚Äì the easiest way to manipulate text, bend fonts, and add unique typography effects to your designs.
plugins.tagline: Reshape, Warp, Manipulate and Transform Text with SVG Path Export

plugins.name: Variant Organiser
plugins.description:
Keep your variants tidy with Variant Organiser


Variant Organiser automatically arranges variants in a grid and creates property labels.


NEW IN VERSION 7 ‚Äì Automatic Mode


How to run Variant Organiser


Variant Organiser is keyboard operated from Figma‚Äôs quick actions search bar:


‚Üí Type ‚åò + / to open Figma‚Äôs quick actions search bar (or CTRL + / if you are on Windows)

‚Üí Start typing ‚ÄúVariant Organiser‚Äù to search for the plugin


Using the 'Manual' command


'Manual' is the new name for the 'Organise' command you know and love. Use it when you want control over the logic for ordering variants. 'Manual' mode is only available for component sets with two or more variant properties.


‚Üí First select the component set you want to organise

‚Üí Search for and select Variant Organiser > Organise in Figma‚Äôs quick actions search bar

‚Üí Follow the prompts:

  1. Select which property to use for columns in the primary grid
  2. Select which property to use for rows in the primary grid. If your component only has two properties, that's sufficient to arrange the variants in a simple grid. If you have more properties, this grid will be repeated to form blocks of variants within a larger grid.
  3. Hit Tab to if you want to chose a property to generate horizontal blocks. This step is optional.
  4. Hit Enter to generate the full grid structure. Any remaining properties will be used to group variants vertically.


Using the 'Automatic' command


The 'Automatic' command organises variants automatically, without asking you to enter any parameters. Variants are organised based on the order that variant properties appear in Figma's right sidebar. 'Automatic' mode works on component sets with any number of variant properties. Use 'Automatic' mode when your component set only has one variant property.


How to edit spacing preferences


You can edit the spacing between variants, as well as the block spacing in Preferences.


‚Üí Search for and select Variant Organiser > Preferences in Figma‚Äôs quick actions search bar

‚Üí Follow the prompts:

  1. Enter the Variant spacing
  2. Enter the Block spacing
  3. Hit Enter to save your preferences
plugins.tagline: Automatically arrange variants in a grid and create property labels

plugins.name: Accessibility Simulator (Test compliance with WCAG AA 2.1 guidelines)
plugins.description:
Accessibility Simulator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers better understand the challenges faced by users with common visual impairments.


By simulating different types of vision issues, Accessibility Simulator equips designers to identify potential accessibility issues early in the design process, ensuring a more inclusive user experience.


Accessibility Simulator currently covers:

  • Light Sensitivity
  • Vision loss (Acute and Severe)
  • Color Blindness (RG and BY)


Note this plugin can run slow on large files!

  • We are working on speeding it up.
  • If you run into an issue try copying a section of your design to a new page and running it there.
  • If you have issues with the plugin please leave a comment and we will take a look.


----


Check out the: Compressed PDF and Image Exporter Plugin to create better PDFs and images from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Improve your design's accessibility by simulating visual impairments and ensuring WCAG compliance.

plugins.name: Visual Studio Code Icons
plugins.description:
Browse and copy Visual Studio Code icon glyphs using Codicons and Seti.


Usage


Insert a glyph into your document by selecting it from the list. If a text layer is highlighted, the glyph will replace the content and adopt the color style, otherwise it will be inserted at the center of the visible canvas.


Updating fonts


To ensure consistent behaviour in the plugin, whenever the font updates a notification will appear in the plugin UI. Follow the instructions to update the font in Figma, then restart the plugin.

plugins.name: JSON ‚Üí Content
plugins.description:
Easily map your data and layers together by using the same name. Either select specific entries from your overview or shuffle through them for a randomised dataset


Tired of incoherent random data?

Set up your data separately as a JSON or CSV file and start adding your content. The content of the datasets always remain together to create a seamless data retrieval experience.


Easy mapping via layer name

Map your data and your layers together simply by using the same name. The name of your text layers only needs to match the key of your object and the value will be parsed.


Selection rewriting

Overwrite multiple text layers within your selection and any data that‚Äôs attached to the entry will be written into layers that have the same name as the key.


Choose between specific or randomised data

When you have imported your data, the plugin will print a list with every entry that‚Äôs in your file. Click on an entry if you need specific data from that set.


Multiple datasets via tab menu

Push your productivity even more with the new tab menu feature. It's now possible to set up multiple datasets without switching between files.


Iterate over random entries

Iterate over multiple entries of your list to your selection. The next entry will be used as soon as the same data would be applied a second time.


(New) Use multi-layered JSON files

You can now utilize the power of layered JSON files if needed. This is a much more common way of writing JSON and allows for more flexibility. Files which have worked before will work as expected.

plugins.name: Reframer
plugins.description:
Reframer lets you quickly resize your device mockups using a top down responsive layout method. When you run Reframer, it will convert your frame to a vertical auto layout and absolutely position your top and bottom fixed elements whilst also applying the appropriate iOS Status Bar and Home Indicator style.


Choose your device:


  • iPhone 13 Pro Max
  • iPhone 13 / 13 Pro
  • iPhone 13 Mini
  • iPhone 11 Pro Max
  • iPhone 11 Pro / X
  • iPhone 8 Plus
  • iPhone 8
  • iPhone SE (First Gen)


How To Use


1. Ensure your frame has a `Fixed Top` or `Fixed Bottom`

2. Choose the frame you want to reframe

3. Run Reframer > Choose Device...

4. Choose the device you would like to reframe to

5. Profit


Toggle Frame Hugging


Because Reframer converts your frame to a vertical auto layout you can take advantage of this to quickly toggle between device height and the content height of your mockup.


Simply run Reframer > Toggle Frame Hugging


Toggle to content height before previewing your design as a prototype and you will notice the content is not cut off by the Fixed Bottom element.


Vertical Scroll Prototype Ready


Reframer will setup your frame with vertical scrolling, so you can fire up the Figma iOS app on your test devices and really experience what the design feels like with no extra effort.


Top & Bottom Fixed Elements


To allow Reframer to automatically position your top and bottom fixed elements they must be contained within a Frame or Component named `Fixed Top` or `Fixed Bottom` respectively.


Tip: You can add absolutely positioned elements inside of the Fixed Top and Fixed Bottom elements. For example, if you app requires a FAB you can add it inside the Fixed Bottom element.


Status Bars


Reframer will automatically apply the correct iOS status bar style to your mocks providing your Status Bar component has a `Notched` variant property.


Home Indicators


Reframer will toggle your Home Indicator according to the iOS device you have chosen to reframe to.


Absolutely Positioned Children


After you have run Reframer you can add absolutely positioned children to your mocks and when you reframe to a different device, Reframer will respect the absolute position of the new child.


Love Reframer? Buy me a coffee ü§©

accepted.name: Kirk Bentley
accepted.description:
Pixel pusher & Tiger herder

Love my resources?
Buy me a coffee:  https://www.buymeacoffee.com/kirkbentley

plugins.name: Real Forms
plugins.description:
Create realistic forms for prototyping with inputs that allow users to type as they would in a real application.


Note: each form element has to be transformed independently. If you create an input field using the plugin and then duplicate it, they will not work independently.


Note: Only text inputs, checkboxes and dropdowns are currently supported.


How to use:


This plugin will use AI to understand how many form elements you want to transform into working prototypes, if you select e.g. four variants of an input field, only one working input field prototype will be created in the end.


Instructions on how to use:

  • For inputs, selecting an input and any variants should be sufficient to get the results.
  • Checkboxes should have a frame with an icon/frame inside that shows the checked state.
  • When selecting a dropdown, you must also select it in combination with the frame(s) that show the list of options.


For any queries or for a walkthrough, please email sisu@pixelprime.app
plugins.tagline: Create working form inputs and prototypes

plugins.name: Vev - Turn Figma Designs into Websites
plugins.description:
Vev is a web creation platform for publishing your wildest ideas to the web with complete creative and technical freedom. With our Figma plugin, you can instantly turn static Figma files into responsive, publication-ready websites without coding a thing.


Design in Figma > Publish in Vev


  1. Run the plugin in Figma
  2. Paste your Figma project URL
  3. Select the layer you want to migrate
  4. Style with Vev‚Äôs pre-coded animations
  5. Add custom code if you like
  6. Publish anywhere on the web


Once you‚Äôve imported your design into Vev, play with our pre-coded design components to bring it to life‚Äîweaving in scrollytelling videos, parallax effects, 3D objects, advanced animations, and more.


Our Figma plugin takes care of aligning design components and structuring layouts, it picks up all styles and auto-layout components, and it adds each Figma frame as individual sections for easy styling‚Äîall so you can just focus on making great websites. 


** We are actively collecting feedback to further improve the Figma-to-Vev import process. That means this plugin undergoes constant testing and development to ensure optimum performance. We warmly welcome feedback and comments at hello@vev.design.

plugins.name: variables
plugins.description:
Create global variables and link them to any property across any layer. Experiment with your designs, keep organized, and unlock new functionality within Figma.


üìï Playground and documentation

Start by duplicating this handy file in the community! Check out interactive lessons and documentation, and see how variables can transform the way you work in Figma.


‚úÖ Features

  • Use variables to control nearly 60 layer properties like blurs, variant properties, gradients, layer visibility, shadows, size, rotation, text, padding, and much more.
  • Use combo variables to modify your existing variables with math. For example, set a variable to be the value of another variable divided by 2, or multiply two of your variables together.
  • Switch between variable sets. Quickly swap between different sets of variables, giving you the ability to maintain version history and experiment on your designs with different variable values. Have different variable sets available on each page of your document, or choose to share them across the whole document. You can even access the same variable sets across all of your files.
  • Control instances, variant properties, and styles. Whether you want to dynamically switch between text or fill styles, toggle a property on or off in a component set instance, or swap an instance to a totally different parent component, variables has you covered.
  • Batch edit specific properties, like blur, shadow offset, and contrast, across different images or shadows without requiring the other properties to match.


ü§î How to use

That‚Äôs really up to you! Variables and linked properties work together to do whatever you want. At the bare minimum, you create a variable in the Variables tab. You can then use that variable to link it to the same property across different layers. Or different properties on the same layer. Or any combination you can dream up. Go wild! For inspiration, check out the playground and documentation file.


‚òïÔ∏è Support the plugin

If you love the plugin and feel inclined to provide some small financial support to encourage the development of new features and bug fixes, that would be greatly appreciated. No pressure, of course!

Buy me a coffee


üöß Roadmap

  • The option for layers with linked variables to be automatically updated when you rename a variable.
  • Variable value previews in the Properties tab
  • Much more!


_

accepted.name: Dan Araujo
accepted.description:
Product Designer and Creator
Currently Head of Product at Subtext

plugins.name: Radar Chart
plugins.description:
Create custom radar/spider charts directly in Figma.


Features


Custom Data Points: Input your own data points to generate a radar chart tailored to your data.

Styling Options: Customize the appearance of the radar chart with color pickers, rounding inputs, and more.


Usage


  • Input your desired minimum and maximum values for the data scale.
  • Add your data points. By default, you have six data points, but you can add more if needed.
  • Customize the appearance using the provided styling options.
  • Click "Create Chart" to generate the radar chart on your Figma canvas.


Feature Roadmap

Radar Chart is in development. Additional features in development are:

  • Choose graph style
  • Number labels for data
  • Choose scale division

Export Non-transparent PNG that required by App Store assets submission.


This plugin helps you remove the alpha channel of your exported image generate by Figma.


After install the plugin,


  1. Right click on any group / layer you want to export, choose Export Opaque PNG - Mark Opaque
  2. Under the normal Export Section, you could see Plugin - Export Opaque PNG, click it you could export it.


Based on Android Resources Export by Ashung Hung

AIcons is an icon set built for use in designing interfaces with LLMs and generative AI.


AIcons has a set of 300+ icons and counting. Built with a 2px stroke, AIcons has two styles, Outline and Fill.


How to Use


Click on any of the icons to drop them into your Figma file. Drag and drop works, too!

plugins.name: Mini Magic Moodboard and Art Generator
plugins.description:
Mini Magic Moodboard Generator is a powerful plugin that enables designers and creatives to quickly and easily create stunning vector-graphic moodboards and background art.


You can easily experiment with different color palettes, detail, and design elements to get inspiration for your design project.


Control Explanation:

  • Add some color: Use color controls to guide the app, but you'll notice it takes some liberty
  • Add some light: This generally adds some contrast to dark and light palettes.
  • Add some complexity: This adds more objects to the composition and totally changes your artwork. High risk, high reward.
  • Add some depth: This is a surprise. Try it out!

Learn more about MMMG


----------------------


Pro Mode:

Upgrade in the app to support development and get Pro Mode lifetime access.

  • Get lifetime access: No sign ups, no keys to copy and paste. It's a one-click upgrade!
  • Skip the queue: Get instant minis. Generate as fast as you can click.
  • More advanced controls: 
  • Set the style: Shapes, Blobs, Confetti
  • Add accent colors
  • Change the artwork composition
  • Change the aspect ratio
  • Bulk generator: It's a numbers game. Getting more minis means you will get more great minis.

Please leave a comment for any features you want to see in the next release! Report a bug

plugins.name: Image Resizer Plugin
plugins.description:
Main Features:


Resize Image: Choose from a list of commonly used image sizes or enter your desired dimensions separated by commas.

Export High-Quality Images: Export your images in high-quality 300 DPI JPGs and PNGs, perfect for print and detailed presentations.

Mockup automation: Add your product into mockups in one click.


How It Works:


Resize and Export:

Select the image you want to resize or export within your Figma project.

Launch the Image Resizer plugin.

For resizing, choose from the list of predefined sizes or enter your custom dimensions.

For exporting, select your desired format and ensure you choose the 300 DPI option for high-quality results.

Click "Resize" or "Export", and the plugin will process your images instantly.


Automated Mockup Generator:

  • Bring your own mockups
  • Name frames as 'MockupFrame'
  • Name placeholders as 'ImagePlaceholder'
  • Select an image, text, group. or shape in Figma
  • Click "Add to Mockup" and the plugin will add your product to mockups instantly.


Trial & Payment:

Image Resizer operates on a freemium model. Users are allowed to use the plugin for a trial period of up to 15 uses. After the trial usages are exhausted, users will be prompted to make a payment to continue using the plugin without restrictions.


How to manage subscriptions?

You may only subscribe through the Image Resizer Plugin, we only export your figma user id to manage the subscription.


You may easily manage your subscription in Stripe through below link.

https://billing.stripe.com/p/login/aEUbLA6vh59HfcI5kk


If any questions or support needed, you may contact us via the contact email.

plugins.name: Figmaster
plugins.description:
The world's first design systems workbook for Figma


Learn how to build your design system from scratch by doing exercises in Figma


Visit the official website to learn more


What is Figmaster?

In short, the Figmaster plugin is a workbook for Figma that contains a large set of exercises on how to build your modern design system from scratch.


How does it work?

By doing exercises in Figma, you learn and create your guide style and component library simultaneously. It is a format that will help you get the most out of each lesson. By learning - you create, and by the way, you get to know keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and techniques of working in Figma that will speed up your workflow. Everything happens in Figma - no distractions.


Course description

Design Systems are becoming so popular because they make products more consistent, accessible, improve their usability, and reduce design decision-making.

Nowadays, companies and individuals need to learn how to design advanced components, style guides, and documentation in Figma. Improving the workflow and onboarding the new designers to the team is also a challenge.

In Figmaster, you will learn how to create a design system from scratch in Figma. The Figmaster is purely and simply about practice, so you can start using acquired knowledge right away.

In this course, you will learn how to set up all the needed design tokens, such as defining proper grids, layouts, spacing, managing icons, choosing and creating color and typographic scales. You will also learn how to make the components like buttons, inputs, modals, text areas, checkboxes, notifications, radio buttons‚Ä¶ You will learn how to name components correctly using naming conventions and translate your components into variants. You will also learn how to improve your workflow by using handy keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and tricks. At the end of this course, you will create your own complete Design System and apply it anywhere with confidence.

In the team version, you will learn how to work on a design system in a team and how to onboard new designers with the Figmaster. I will also share resources so you can learn more about design systems theory and get inspiration from the existing systems.

We will use the full potential of Figma, making our Design System with variants, auto layout, and the latest Figma feature: interactive components. üéâ

So if you want to learn how to create a Design System from scratch in Figma, this is for you.


Module 1. Style Guide

In the first module, we'll create design tokens and convert them into Figma Styles. We'll prepare the icon library for the entire system. We'll also set up some spacing rules that we'll follow in the next modules.


Module 2. Components

In the second module, we'll use the Styles, icons, and rules from the previous module to create the components.


Module 3. Documentation

In the third module, we'll create documentation components and frames. Then, we'll document our components and styles. In this module, you'll also learn how to make your components interactive.


Module 4. Use it

In the fourth module, we'll build a simple UI with our design system. I'll also show you how to customize it for your needs. That is, change the colors, typography, or component properties to match your product or brand requirements.


Module 5. Team license bonus

In the last module, I'll show you how to work with a design system we created in a team. You'll also learn how to onboard new designers to the library. As a bonus, you'll also get access to additional resources on design systems, such as links, articles, book recommendations, etc.

16090.name: Figmaster

Learn how to build your design system from scratch by doing exercises in Figma


Visit the official website to learn more


What is Figmaster?

In short, the Figmaster plugin is a workbook for Figma that contains a large set of exercises on how to build your modern design system from scratch.


How does it work?

By doing exercises in Figma, you learn and create your guide style and component library simultaneously. It is a format that will help you get the most out of each lesson. By learning - you create, and by the way, you get to know keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and techniques of working in Figma that will speed up your workflow. Everything happens in Figma - no distractions.


Course description

Design Systems are becoming so popular because they make products more consistent, accessible, improve their usability, and reduce design decision-making.

Nowadays, companies and individuals need to learn how to design advanced components, style guides, and documentation in Figma. Improving the workflow and onboarding the new designers to the team is also a challenge.

In Figmaster, you will learn how to create a design system from scratch in Figma. The Figmaster is purely and simply about practice, so you can start using acquired knowledge right away.

In this course, you will learn how to set up all the needed design tokens, such as defining proper grids, layouts, spacing, managing icons, choosing and creating color and typographic scales. You will also learn how to make the components like buttons, inputs, modals, text areas, checkboxes, notifications, radio buttons‚Ä¶ You will learn how to name components correctly using naming conventions and translate your components into variants. You will also learn how to improve your workflow by using handy keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and tricks. plugins.name: Magic Color Palettes
plugins.description:
Magic Color Palettes can fill an element with a single color, add a palette to the local styles or generate a palette on the page.


The library includes hundreds of carefully selected color palettes, designed to enhance your interfaces and illustrations.


The wide spectrum of hues draws inspiration from many art forms, ranging from Van Gogh's immortal Starry Night to cinematic classics like Pulp Fiction.


Regularly revisit and discover an ever-growing variety of wonderful palettes, added daily.
plugins.tagline: Carefully selected color palettes, designed to enhance your interfaces and illustrations.

plugins.name: Reattach Instance
plugins.description:
Relink a frame to a component by searching for similar instances.

---

Use cases:
‚Ä¢ Copying a nested component
‚Ä¢ Moving the master component to a different file
‚Ä¢ Turning a set of similar frames into a component
‚Ä¢ Turning detached instances back into instances

---

How it works:
 1. Select frames (that used to be instances)
 2. Click "Plugin/Reattach instance"
 3. Plugin finds instances or master components with the same name
 4. New instance is created for each corresponding frame
 5. The selected frames are replaced by instances üéâ

üëâ NEW: Overrides will now be applied to instances!

---

Known problems:
‚Ä¢ Relies too much on layer naming
‚Ä¢ Needs to have an instance/master as a reference on the same file
‚Ä¢ Doesn't work all the time with team libraries

Feel free to contribute üòÖ
https://github.com/renancamm/figma-reattache-instance
